article_title: Health care mandate brings Insperity more business
article_text:
Health care mandate brings Insperity more business

Photo: Eric Kayne, Freelance Inside the boardroom at Insperity, Sept. 27, 2011 in Kingwood, TX....

The federal health care mandate is a boon for human-resources firm Insperity as more employers seek outside help meeting Affordable Care Act coverage and reporting provisions that kick in over the next two years.

article_metadata.description: The federal health care mandate is a boon for human-resources firm Insperity as more employers seek outside help meeting Affordable Care Act coverage and reporting provisions that kick in over the next two years.  "The government, over time, for businesses like ours, has become our best salesman," said Paul Foery, who oversees insurance services for Houston-based Insperity, which offers recruiting, accounting, benefits and other human-resource services to companies across the U.S. that range in size from five to 5,000 employees.  In January, companies with 100 or more full-time employees will have to offer health insurance that meets the standards of the act, known as the ACA, or face penalties.  Employers worried about complying with the law, which outlines minimum coverage standards and has new reporting requirements, are turning to companies like Insperity.  For their clients, some insurance packages have changed and Insperity will collect additional information to do the proper reporting.  Insperity takes care of enrolling employees, answering questions and reporting information to the government.
article_metadata.author.name: By Sarah Scully
